description: Initializes a Support Vector Machine (SVM) regression model. This component sets up the model structure but does not perform training or handle data splitting. The resulting model can be trained later using ``ml_fit``.

parameters.name: kernel
parameters.description: Specifies the kernel type to be used in the algorithm.

parameters.name: C
parameters.description: Regularization parameter. The strength of the regularization is inversely proportional to C. Must be strictly positive.

parameters.name: epsilon
parameters.description: Epsilon in the epsilon-SVR model. Specifies the epsilon-tube within which no penalty is associated in the training loss function with points predicted within a distance epsilon from the actual value.

parameters.name: gamma
parameters.description: Kernel coefficient for 'rbf', 'poly', and 'sigmoid'. Higher values lead to tighter fits.

parameters.name: degree
parameters.description: Degree of the polynomial kernel function (only relevant for 'poly' kernel).

parameters.name: coef0
parameters.description: Independent term in the kernel function (only relevant for 'poly' and 'sigmoid' kernels).

parameters.name: cachesize
parameters.description: Size of the kernel cache in MB.

parameters.name: seed
parameters.description: A randomization seed to use for reproducibility. If not given or `null`, no seed is used and results may differ on subsequent use.

returns.description: A model object that can be trained using ``ml_fit``.

links.title: Awad, M., Khanna, R., Awad, M., & Khanna, R. (2015). Support vector regression. Efficient learning machines: Theories, concepts, and applications for engineers and system designers.
